title: The Dreaming. Series 2
subject_group: Aboriginal Australia/Aboriginal Australians - Social life and customs
Anthropology, Ethnology, Exploration & Travel/Aboriginal Australians - Legends
Advertising, Film, Journalism, Mass Media & TV/Animators
Advertising, Film, Journalism, Mass Media & TV/Animation (Cinematography)
abstract: 4 tapes, 1 booklet Tape 1: Part 1 - An introduction to understanding the Dreaming and its significance as an educational resource ; Part 2 - A compilation of interviews and information about the storytellers (15 mins.)--Tape 2: 4 stories (each 11-13 mins. duration) The Goori Goori bird ; Thukeri ; How the mopoke came to be ; The Dolphin (50 mins. total)--Tape 3: 4 stories (each 11-15 mins. duration) Djet ; The Butterfly ; Ballawinne (red ochre) ; The Two wise men and the seven sisters (52 mins. total)--Tape 4: 5 stories (each 12-15 mins. duration) The Moon and his two wives ; Blue mountain butterfly ; Buda:dji ; The Stone canoe ; Tree duck (51 mins. total)--Booklet: Teacher's guide.
description: Series two of "The Dreaming" consists of thirteen of a total of 78 short animations of Aboriginal Dreaming stories that make up the six part series. This ambitious project was produced by Aboriginal Nations, an independent animation company committed to employing Aboriginal animators. With reference to an intellectual property protocol developed by the company, the stories were sourced from Aboriginal communities, and the permission to tell and animate them was obtained from community elders. The soundtracks utilise the voices of Aboriginal actors and feature original music by Aboriginal composers. A comprehensive teachers guide and supporting videos introducing the Dreaming and offering insights into the storytelling and animation process are also included.
